children.value: WUI Core Methods
A collection of useful helper methods that are used throughout the WUI.

tags.title: author
tags.description: Stephen Nielsen (rolfe.nielsen@gmail.com)

children.value: Returns a string that will be a unique id to use on the DOM. Output in the format 'prefix-n'.

Wui.id();
// returns wui-0;

Wui.id('ts');
// returns ts-1;

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional. A string to use before the number. Default is 'wui'.
tags.name: prefix

tags.title: returns
tags.description: The prefix plus a number that is incremented each time this function is called.

children.value: Optional. A string to use before the number. Default is 'wui'.
The prefix plus a number that is incremented each time this function is called.
Shorthand for typing typeof comparisons everywhere.

tags.title: param
tags.description:
Only an object in the sense that everything in JS is an object. It
                                 can be any variable you want to check whether it is defined.
tags.name: key

tags.title: returns
tags.description: True if the item is not undefined.

children.value:
Only an object in the sense that everything in JS is an object. It
                                 can be any variable you want to check whether it is defined.
True if the item is not undefined.
Gets the maximum CSS z-index on the page and returns one higher, or one if no z-indexes are defined.

tags.title: param
tags.description:
(Optional) A parameter passed to this method will be taken as
                                 the item itself we are seeking the z-index for and will not
                                 include itsef when calculating the maximum index (not doing
                                 this will increment the z-index of the item every time this
                                 method is called on it).
tags.name: el

tags.title: returns
tags.description: A number representing the maximum z-index on the page plus one.

children.value:
(Optional) A parameter passed to this method will be taken as
                                 the item itself we are seeking the z-index for and will not
                                 include itsef when calculating the maximum index (not doing
                                 this will increment the z-index of the item every time this
                                 method is called on it).
A number representing the maximum z-index on the page plus one.
Determines whether the passed in string can be used as a percentage

tags.title: param
tags.description: A string to be taken as a percent
tags.name: val

tags.title: returns
tags.description: True if the value is a number with a percent character

children.value: A string to be taken as a percent
True if the value is a number with a percent character
Determines the width of the scroll bar for the current browser/OS

tags.title: returns
tags.description: The width of the scrollbar

children.value: The width of the scrollbar
Gets an object containing all the styles defined for an object from stylesheets to inline styles.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The element for which to get styles. This should NOT be a jquery object.
tags.name: elem

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Object containing key value pairs of style rules and their values.

children.value: The element for which to get styles. This should NOT be a jquery object.
Object containing key value pairs of style rules and their values.
Gets all of the options in a select box

tags.title: param
tags.description: A node, jQuery object, or selector string for a <select> node
tags.name: target

tags.title: returns
tags.description: An array full of objects that represent the option values in the select

children.value: A node, jQuery object, or selector string for a
<select>
node
An array full of objects that represent the option values in the select
Converts a percentage string to an integer pixel value based on the passed in element's parent

tags.title: param
tags.description: The element that will get the percentage applied to it
tags.name: el

tags.title: param
tags.description: A string containing a number and percent sign
tags.name: percent

tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional. 'width'|'height'. Default is 'width'.
tags.name: dim

tags.title: returns
tags.description: The Math.floor pixel value of the percent of the width of 'el''s parent.

children.value: The element that will get the percentage applied to it
A string containing a number and percent sign
Optional. 'width'|'height'. Default is 'width'.
The Math.floor pixel value of the percent of the width of 'el''s parent.

Absolutely positions a child element, relative to its parent, such that it will be visible within the viewport
and at the max z-index. Useful for dialogs and drop-downs.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The element to which the child will be relatively positioned.
tags.name: parent

tags.title: param
tags.description: The element to be positioned.
tags.name: child

children.value: The element to which the child will be relatively positioned.
The element to be positioned.

Determines whether data is expected to be in containers separating values for the total and the
data, or if the data cones in in an array, there is no need to unwrap it.

tags.title: param
tags.description: Object or array that is the response data from a request.
tags.name: response

tags.title: returns
tags.description: An object with cleanly separated data and total columns.

children.value: Object or array that is the response data from a request.
An object with cleanly separated data and total columns.
